articles.title: Commemorations abroad
articles.content:
Preparatory committee inaugurated in Zambia 
  Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee was inaugurated in Zambia on November 29 to commemorate the sixth anniversary of Kim Jong Il's election as Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army and the 80th birth anniversary of Kim Jong Suk, a great communist revolutionary fighter.
   The chairman of the Zambia-Korea Friendship Association was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
   The first meeting of the preparatory committee decided to hold a ten-day film show and a photo exhibition week and other colorful events from December 1 to 1

articles.title: Russian aeroplane exhibition and demonstration flight in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Commemorations abroad
   Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- The 6th anniversary of Kim Jong Il's election as Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army and the 80th birth anniversary of  Kim Jong Suk, a great communist revolutionary fighter, were commemorated in Uganda and Madagascar.
   A month of Korean photo exhibition and film show began in Kampala on November 28.
   The Ugandan Minister of State for the Ministry of Natural Resources in his speech declared the month of Korean photo exhibition and film show.
   He said:
   Comrade Kim Jong Suk, a great communist revolutionary fighter, is an outstanding woman revolutionary who embarked upon the road of revolution in her early years and devoted her whole life to the victory of the Korean revolution with her boundless loyalty to President Kim Il Sung.
   She made sure that the revolution could be carried forward to accomplish the cause of Juche started by President Kim Il Sung.
   As they are led by Kim Jong Il, the Korean people are dynamically advancing along the road of socialism, true to the instructions of President Kim Il Sung.
   Korean films were screened at Juche school and Nansan Senior Middle School in Madagascar.

articles.title: Soldier-builders of recreation ground commended
articles.content:
Russian aeroplane exhibition and demonstration flight in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- A Russian aeroplane exhibition and demonstration flight were held here from Dec. 3 to 5.
   Present were officials of the General Civil Aviation Bureau of the DPRK and members of the "   IL-96m"   delegation led by Genrikh Novozhilov, general designer of the Ilyushin Aviation Complex of Russia, and the "  TU-204-100"    delegation led by Alexander Poukhov, chief constructor of the Tupolev Joint-Stock Company of Russia.
   The participants looked round the interior and exterior of new-type passanger planes " IL-96m"   and " TU-204-100"  and learned about their structure and powers.
   And they saw the take-off, flight and landing of the passanger planes.

articles.title: R..S. on carrying through WPK's call for living our own way
articles.content:
Soldier-builders of recreation ground commended
 Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- A state commendation ceremony was held for soldiers of the Korean People's Army who participated in the building of the Mt. Kuwol Recreation Ground on dec. 5. 
   Officers and soldiers of the KPA were commended for their heroic feats in harnessing nature with indomitable will and in the revolutionary spirit of armymen and building Mt. Kuwol, a noted mountain on the west coast, into cultural increation ground for the people, true to the behests of President Kim Il Sung and orders of General Kim Jong Il, Supreme Commander.
   The title of Labour Hero of the DPRK was awarded to Sin Tae Gyun, a general of the KPA, and two others, the " Kim Il Sung Order"  to KPA units and an officer, the " Kim Il Sung Youth Honour Prize"  to nine soldiers, an honorary title to one soldier and orders and medals to thousands of soldiers.
   Watches bearing the name of President Kim Il Sung and commendations of General Kim Jong Il were also awarded to soldiers.

articles.title: National meeting of active cultural preservation workers held
articles.content:
R..S. on carrying through WPK's call for living our own way
 Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- In order to achieve greater victory in today's struggle to glorify a new era of the Juche revolution, it is necessary to carry through the call of the Workers' Party of Korea " Let us live our own way !."  In all domains of the revolution and construction.
   Rodong Sinmun says this in an editorial today.
   The daily goes on:
   For the WPK and the Korean people to live their own way at present means to cherish deep in their mind General Kim Jong Il's idea of and faith in independence and carry out the revolution and construction the way he does.
   The Korean way contains man-centred philosophy and patriotic soul. The Korean people have no better slogan than this. 
   To carry out the call is a steadfast guarantee for decisively smashing the imperialists' moves to isolate and stifle the DPRK and firmly defending our socialism. 
   The Korean-style strategy and way of revolution are a powerful weapon to take the initiative and win victory in the struggle against the enemy. When we successfully carry through this call of the party we can strictly reject the ideological and cultural infiltration of the imperialists and build the sound traits and way of life in society. To this end, we should firmly maintain the revolutionary principle, the principle of independence, in confrontation with the enemy and uncompromisingly struggle against the moves to encroach upon the dignity and sovereignty of the Korean nation.

articles.title: Korean boxers successful at international tournament
articles.content:
National meeting of active cultural preservation workers held
 Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- A national meeting of active cultural preservation workers took place here on Dec. 4 and 5.
   The meeting, the first of its kind in Korea, reviewed the proud achievements and experiences in the cultural preservation and discussed the tasks to effect a new turn in preserving national culture in keeping with the requirement of the developing reality and firmly defend and further exalt the undying feats performed by President Kim Il Sung and General Kim Jong Il in reclaiming the national cultural heritage.
   The Workers' Party of Korea Central Committee in a congratulatory message to the meeting said that the cultural preservation workers sincerely carried out their honourable tasks and registered great achievements in implementing the party's policy of cultural preservation.
   They found out Tangun cemetery and other remains and relics worthy of national treasure through a nationwide drive for surveying and unearthing national cultural heritage and made a scientific study of historical evidence, greatly contributing to increasing the cultural wealth of the country, systematizing and further glorifying the five-thousand-year history of the nation on a Juche-based way.
   They restored precious historical remains and relics to the original state, arranged well history museums, history relics sites and scenic spots as places for mass education and organized visits to them and thus made active contributions to educating the people in the Korean-nation-first spirit, the patriotic spirit, and instilling national pride and self-confidence into their minds.
   Present at the meeting were Pak Song Chol, member of the Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee and Vice-President, and other senior party and state officials.
   Vice-Premier of the Administration Council and Minister of Culture and Art Jang Chol made a report, which was followed by speeches of many participants.

Korean boxers successful at international tournament
 Pyongyang, December 6 (KCNA) -- Korean boxer Pak Chol Jun carried off gold cup, gold medal and diploma in the 57 kg category, Cha Ho Chol silver cup and silver medal in the 51 kg category and Ri Chol bronze medal in the 63.5 kg category at the 97 China Egana Cup A-Class International Boxing Tournament held in Guangzhou, China.
